messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
No, Reza, 911.
Okay, can you tell me your name and the location of the emergency?
Amber, 150 North Preston.
Okay, 150 North Preston. What's the problem?
Yes, I had a baby. They were sleeping. She was choking on her vomit, and I don't know what's going on.
Is she awake?
No, me and my daughter are here. I'm trying to help, but I really don't know what I'm doing.
Okay, I can give you instructions. What I need you to do is lay her on her back.
Okay.
Put one hand underneath her back and tilt her head slightly back to open the airway.
Okay.
Is she breathing softly?
I can hear her heart, but I'm not sure if she's breathing.
Check if she has a pulse.
Yes, she has a pulse, but she's not waking up.
Ma'am, I need you to calm down and tell me if she's breathing.
I don't know. All the vomit is out of her mouth.
Okay, I need you to roll her onto her side and tap her back gently to make sure the airway is clear.
Okay.
Now put your mouth over her nose and mouth, give her two breaths, and make sure her chest rises.
Okay, it did. Her chest rose.
Is she breathing on her own now?
Yes, she is.
Alright, the officer should be on the scene soon. Do you hear them?
I hear him.
Okay, I'm going to let you go now. You're doing great.
